title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
text: CBTF package implements simple mechanism fuzz-testing functions public interface R package. Fuzz testing helps identify functions lack sufficient argument validation, uncovers sets inputs , valid function signature, may cause issues within function body. core functionality package fuzz() function, calls provided function certain input records output produced. error warning generated, captured reported user, unless matches pattern whitelisted messages, specified ignore_patterns argument. objects returned fuzz() can inspected summary() print(). Whitelisting can also done fuzz run completed via whitelist() function, messages need acted upon actually shown. Using whitelist() advantage requiring run fuzzer functions inputs . Note fuzz() uses mirai package asynchronous operations parallelisation, execution occurs persistent background processes. can started automatically specifying daemons option; alternatively, can set manually mirai::daemons() function; refer original mirai documentation complete description arguments behaviour. helper function get_exported_functions() identifies functions public interface given package, facilitating generation list functions fuzzed. helper function test_inputs() invoked fuzz() user doesn‚Äôt specify set inputs tested. default generates large set potentially problematic inputs, can limited just desired classes inputs.

title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
text: simple example displays use CBTF fuzz R package. consider mime small enough run quickly likely installed systems. first occurrence false positive, message returned indicates input checked function returned cleanly. second case instead reveals function didn‚Äôt validate input: indeed, expected environment, used $ operation without checking. false positive result can easily removed whitelisting appropriate pattern:
code: library(CBTF) funs <- get_exported_functions("mime") (res <- fuzz(funs, what = list(TRUE))) ## ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 2 functions with 1 input (using 2 daemons) ## ‚Ñπ 2 tests run  [4ms] ## ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[1]]: TRUE ##       guess_type  FAIL  a character vector argument expected ##  parse_multipart  FAIL  $ operator is invalid for atomic vectors ##  ##  [ FAIL 2 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 0 ] whitelist(res, "a character vector argument expected") ## ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[1]]: TRUE ##  parse_multipart  FAIL  $ operator is invalid for atomic vectors ##  ##  [ FAIL 1 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 1 ]

text: example didn‚Äôt specify args argument, therefore first function argument fuzzed. setting args, ‚Äôs possible provide list arguments (length) pass functions fuzzed. fuzz first three arguments matrix() (data, nrow ncol), following: names given elements args, used input lists generated. can helpful fuzz specific argument across several function, fuzz argument comes later argument list passed via .... example, following fuzz data, nrow dimnames arguments: Fuzzing generally effective values args provide good default functions fuzzed; argument fuzzed, others remain valid, allowing broader exploration argument space. However, strictly necessary (may achievable fuzzing multiple functions simultaneously). Additionally, code paths may reached combinations invalid values otherwise remain unexplored.
code: fuzz("matrix", what = list(NA, NULL), args = list(1:4, 2, 2)) ## ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 1 function with 6 inputs (using 2 daemons) ## ‚Ñπ Functions will be searched in the global namespace as `package` was not specified ## ‚Ñπ 6 tests run  [6ms] ## ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[2]]: NULL, 2, 2 ##  matrix  FAIL  'data' must be of a vector type, was 'NULL' ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[3]]: 1:4, NA, 2 ##  matrix  FAIL  invalid 'nrow' value (too large or NA) ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[5]]: 1:4, 2, NA ##  matrix  FAIL  invalid 'ncol' value (too large or NA) ##  ##  [ FAIL 3 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 3 ] fuzz("matrix", what = list(NA, NULL), args = list(1:4, 2, dimnames = NULL)) ## ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 1 function with 6 inputs (using 2 daemons) ## ‚Ñπ Functions will be searched in the global namespace as `package` was not specified ## ‚Ñπ 6 tests run  [6ms] ## ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[2]]: NULL, 2, dimnames = NULL ##  matrix  FAIL  'data' must be of a vector type, was 'NULL' ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[3]]: 1:4, NA, dimnames = NULL ##  matrix  FAIL  invalid 'nrow' value (too large or NA) ##  ## ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[5]]: 1:4, 2, dimnames = NA ##  matrix  FAIL  'dimnames' must be a list ##  ##  [ FAIL 3 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 3 ]

title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
text: implementation fuzz() uses mirai package asynchronous operations parallelisation. allows fuzz functions persistent background processes (daemons) parallel. two main approaches control parallel execution: Setting daemons argument integer value (2 default): start many daemons specified (shut automatically end fuzz run). Note benefit starting daemons number available cores. Manually setting daemons start function: can accomplished via mirai::daemons(), allows specify remote daemons well local one. also avoids cost starting closing daemons fuzz() called multiple times. remains responsibility user close daemons longer use. active daemons found, daemons argument ignored. Refer original mirai documentation complete description arguments behaviour.
code: ## this will start 4 daemons res <- fuzz(funs, daemons = 4) ## set up persistent background processes on the local machine mirai::daemons(4) res <- fuzz(funs)  ## close the background processes mirai::daemons(0)

title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
text: Long-running functions can slow progress fuzz(), default function produce error within 2 seconds, stopped. timed function returns "OK" result, corresponding $msg field recording timeout applied. However, default timeout may short (perhaps long) applications. desired, maximum running time job (seconds) can controlled via timeout argument fuzz()

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions ‚Äî fuzz
text: funs character vector function names test. "package" attribute set package argument provided, functions loaded namespace specified attribute. list objects; used, turn, modify list arguments args calling functions funs. inputs provided, default set inputs generated test_inputs used. set NULL, args must specified, functions called exact list arguments fuzzing occurring. args list default values function arguments. argument list turn replaced element , modified argument list used fuzz functions funs. named arguments present, names used argument names fuzzed functions. NULL (default), first argument function fuzzed. package character string specifying name package search functions. NULL (default), function first check "package" attribute funs, set, names searched global namespace. listify_what Whether input also tested listified version (FALSE default). set TRUE, list(x = x), function operate list(x = x, "list(x)" = list(x)), input object x. ignore_patterns One strings containing regular expressions match errors ignore. strings "unused argument" "missing, default" always ignored. ignore_warnings Whether warnings ignored (FALSE default). daemons Number daemons use (2 default). many mirai daemons specified started entering function closed end, unless active daemons already available, case argument ignored active daemons used. timeout Number seconds (2 default) function fuzzed interrupted result status set "OK".

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions ‚Äî fuzz
text: object class cbtf stores results obtained functions tested. contains following fields: runs list data frames, containing results fuzzing functions funs one inputs . data frame contains following columns attributes: - res: result fuzz test, see possible values. - msg: error warning message returned function, . - attr(*, ""): character representation input tested. funs vector names functions tested. args named list arguments, names generated deparsing args argument already provided. package character string specifying package name function names searched, NA none provided. ignore_patterns value ignore_patterns argument. ignore_warnings value ignore_warnings argument. res column data frames $runs field can contain following values: OK: either error warning produced (case, msg entry left blank), whitelisted (case, message received stored msg), timed (case, msg records timeout applied). SKIP: test run, either given name found, correspond function, function accepts arguments, arguments provided function accepts; exact reason given msg. WARN: warning thrown whitelisting occurred ignore_warnings = FALSE; message stored msg. FAIL: error thrown whitelisting occurred; message stored msg.

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions ‚Äî fuzz
text: list arguments passed functions fuzzed can provided via args argument. element list modified turn object resulting list arguments passed function via .call(). arguments given number formal arguments accepted function, function produce "SKIP" result. arguments named, passed name fuzzed functions. function formal argument name accept ..., standard R behaviour return "unused argument" error. whitelisted default fuzz(), corresponding result status set "OK". possible define arguments remain unchanged fuzzing prefixing name ... arguments use values assigned args without modification. example, ensure argument na.rm always set TRUE, specified ..na.rm = TRUE args. elements args fixed, ignored functions funs called provided args list.

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions ‚Äî fuzz
text: implementation uses mirai backend execute tasks asynchronously parallel worker processes. function can start pool persistent background processes (daemons) size given daemons argument (note starting daemons available cores yields benefit). Alternatively, function can also make use already active daemons started mirai::daemons function: allows control greater detail number processes use, can also remote.

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions ‚Äî fuzz
text: order reduce number false positive results produced, function applies following set rules, establish error warning condition ignored (whitelisting): name function appears error warning message, considered condition handled developer. error warning message contains text "missing, default", produced missing argument used without value assigned . error warning message contains patterns specified ignore_patterns. warning thrown ignore_warnings = TRUE set. whitelisted cases, result "OK", message received stored $msg field (see Value section). Note: Whitelisting can also applied post-hoc results fuzz run using whitelist function.

code: ## set up persistent background processes mirai::daemons(2L)  ## this should produce no errors res <- fuzz(funs = c("list", "matrix", "mean"),             what = test_inputs(c("numeric", "raw"))) #> ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 3 functions with 9 inputs (using 2 daemons) #> ‚Ñπ Functions will be searched in the global namespace as `package` was not specified #> ‚Ñπ 27 tests run  [23ms] summary(res) #> Fuzzed 3 functions on 9 inputs: #>          #>          FAIL WARN SKIP OK #>   list      0    0    0  9 #>   matrix    0    0    0  9 #>   mean      0    3    0  6 #>  #> [ FAIL 0 | WARN 3 | SKIP 0 | OK 24 ]  ## display all results even for successful tests print(res, show_all = TRUE) #> ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[7]]: charToRaw("0")  #>    mean  WARN  argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[8]]: charToRaw("abc")  #>    mean  WARN  argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[9]]: raw()  #>    mean  WARN  argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #>  #>  [ FAIL 0 | WARN 3 | SKIP 0 | OK 24 ]   ## this will catch an error (false positive) fuzz(funs = "matrix",  what = test_inputs("scalar")) #> ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 1 function with 10 inputs (using 2 daemons) #> ‚Ñπ Functions will be searched in the global namespace as `package` was not specified #> ‚Ñπ 10 tests run  [7ms] #> ‚úñ  üö®   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   üö® #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Test input [[10]]: NULL  #>  matrix  FAIL  'data' must be of a vector type, was 'NULL' #>  #>  [ FAIL 1 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 9 ]   ## apply a whitelist pattern to remove the false positive fuzz(funs = "matrix",  what = test_inputs("scalar"),      ignore_patterns = "'data' must be of a vector type") #> ‚Ñπ Fuzzing 1 function with 10 inputs (using 2 daemons) #> ‚Ñπ Functions will be searched in the global namespace as `package` was not specified #> ‚Ñπ 10 tests run  [7ms] #> ‚úî  üèÉ You didn't get caught by the fuzz! #>  #>  [ FAIL 0 | WARN 0 | SKIP 0 | OK 10 ]   ## close the background processes mirai::daemons(0L)

title: CBTF 0.6.0 (2026-02-13)
text: Rewrite fuzz() use backend based mirai package. allows parallelize computations support timeout stop non-failing functions (#4). Add timeout argument fuzz() control number seconds wait interrupting execution function fuzzed. Add args argument allow fuzzing multiple function arguments instead first, support named fixed arguments (#6, #7, #8). Add support = NULL, allows running set arguments listed args modifications. can used fuzz run collect results just one set problematic inputs. Replace show_all logical argument print() show argument accepts class results printed, ‚Äúfail‚Äù, ‚Äúwarn‚Äù, ‚Äúskip‚Äù, ‚Äúok‚Äù ‚Äú‚Äù (#9).

title: CBTF 0.6.0 (2026-02-13)
text: Use unicode symbols terminals support UTF8, respect cli.unicode option, options(cli.unicode = FALSE) can used disable unicode output. Fix bug caused failures +() operator whitelisted just + interpreted regular expression quantifier. Ignore deprecated functions default get_exported_functions(). Add inputs test_inputs(), bringing total number inputs 60 70. Move NA inputs test_inputs() ‚Äúscalar‚Äù new ‚Äúna‚Äù class. Add [[ operator extract results specific test input. Stop exporting namify() helper.

title: CBTF 0.5.0 (2025-08-21)
text: CRAN release: 2025-08-21 Streamline progress report fuzz(). case error warning raised function fuzzed, now report error; previously warning reported tryCatch() implemented. length() S3 method objects class cbtf now counts total number tests performed, instead number inputs tested. Add tabulate argument summary() control whether tabulation results printed terminal . Change internal structure cbtf object store names functions fuzzed . Store values ignore_patterns ignore_warnings options cbtf object. Add whitelist() function remove false positives cbtf object. Make test_input() recognise "help" keyword, case returns vector valid input classes. Add namify() function help create named list custom input objects.

title: CBTF 0.3.0 (2025-07-27)
